translation.GYMWOLF IS THE BEST TOOL TO: GYMWOLF IS THE BEST TOOL TO
translation.assisted seated pectoralis major stretch: assisted seated pectoralis major stretch with stability ball
translation.band one arm twisting chest press: band one arm twisting chest press
translation.Sit on a stability ball with your feet f: Sit on a stability ball with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
translation.Hold a stability ball with both hands an: Hold a stability ball with both hands and extend your arms straight out in front of you.
translation.Slowly lower the stability ball towards: Slowly lower the stability ball towards your chest, feeling a stretch in your pectoral muscles.
translation.Hold the stretch for a few seconds, then: Hold the stretch for a few seconds, then slowly return to the starting position.
translation.Adjust the machine to your desired heigh: Adjust the machine to your desired height and secure your knees on the pad.
translation.Grasp the handles with your palms facing: Grasp the handles with your palms facing down and your arms fully extended.
translation.Lower your body by bending your elbows u: Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the floor.
translation.Pause for a moment, then push yourself b: Pause for a moment, then push yourself back up to the starting position.
translation.Repeat for the desired number of repetit: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
translation.Start in a push-up position with your ha: Start in a push-up position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
translation.Extend one arm straight out to the side,: Extend one arm straight out to the side, parallel to the ground.
translation.Lower your body by bending your elbows,: Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
Push back up to the starting position.
translation.Repeat on the other side, extending the: Repeat on the other side, extending the opposite arm out to the side.
translation.Continue alternating sides for the desir: Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
translation.Heliis has completed the International P: Heliis has completed the International Personal Trainer EGF Level 4 training, she's a triathlon athlete, a judge of the Estonian Triathlon Union and experienced trainer of children at the Tartu Swimming Club. You can also hire Heliis via our online service and have work directly with you through our app
translation.Sarah is a former gymnast and an IFBB bi: Sarah is a former gymnast and an IFBB bikini fitness world champion. To achieve this, she has gained access to, trained with and learned from the best coaches and specialists in the field. Now, based on these experiences, she can help you to set and reach your nutrition and fitness targets and ultimately create a healthy, enjoyable and sustainable lifestyle for you. Inside and outside the gym, she will support your progress every step of the way! Ask her clients, they love her! You can hire Arida to be your PT too, on our website www.gymwolf.com/trainer
translation.Hello, and welcome! I'm Lorel McDowell,: Hello, and welcome! I'm Lorel McDowell, Certified Personal Trainer, MNU Certified Nutritionist, and Pre and Postnatal Specialist. Every day, every session, it has all been part of our shared journey towards growth. Education empowers us, and empowerment builds self-confidence. So, expect to learn as we train! We'll cover training fundamentals, spicing things up to keep it fun.
translation.First up is Erik Kalmus (@erik_k on Inst: First up is Erik Kalmus (@erik_k on Instagram, in case you're interested), our strength and conditioning specialist. A university-trained Strength Sports coach, he is an expert at designing personal training programmes and nutrition plans. He is currently pursuing his master`s degree in Strength and Conditioning with an eye of doing research for an eventual PhD, too. Man's got goals! As a PT, Erik finds that his main job is to change clients' environmental habits such as physical activity, sleep and nutrition by carefully building on their training and fitting it into their lifestyle. He is very dedicated to improving his clients` quality of life and loves to see the results of his work manifest in their lives. You can hire Erik as your personal PT on our website, www.gymwolf.com/trainer
translation.Hi, I am Agne Kask. I am a certified fit: Hi, I am Agne Kask. I am a certified fitness instructor and Neuroathletics coach, specializing in exercise and brain health for older adults. My focus is on helping women maintain vitality, creativity, longevity, and mental sharpness as they age. I am also a certified life and business coach, meditation and mindset coach, personal stylist, and color consultant. My mission is to help women over 50 thrive in every aspect of their lives, empowering them to live with confidence, purpose, and joy.
translation.Siim is a university-trained practicing: Siim is a university-trained practicing physiotherapist, personal trainer and a world-class bodybuilder. He is a strong believer in what does not challenge you, would not change you. Thus, you should expect to be challenged if you work with him. Siim has extensive experience, from working with people with special needs to training elite athletes from freestyle skiing to bodybuilding and bikini fitness. His speciality is physical conditioning along with strength and hypertrophy programs.
translation.Stand with your feet shoulder-width apar: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a towel with both hands behind your head.
translation.Keep your elbows close to your ears and: Keep your elbows close to your ears and your upper arms stationary.
translation.Slowly extend your forearms upward, sque: Slowly extend your forearms upward, squeezing your triceps at the top.
translation.Pause for a moment, then slowly lower th: Pause for a moment, then slowly lower the towel back down to the starting position.
translation.Adjust the machine to your desired weigh: Adjust the machine to your desired weight and height.
translation.Kneel down on the pad facing the machine: Kneel down on the pad facing the machine, with your hands gripping the handles.
translation.Lower your body by bending your elbows,: Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping your back straight and close to the machine.
translation.Pause for a moment at the bottom, then p: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push yourself back up to the starting position.
translation.Stand with your feet shoulder-width apar: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
translation.Keep your elbows close to your sides and: Keep your elbows close to your sides and slowly curl one arm up towards your shoulder, squeezing your biceps at the top.
translation.Lower the arm back down to the starting: Lower the arm back down to the starting position and repeat with the other arm.
translation.Continue alternating arms for the desire: Continue alternating arms for the desired number of repetitions.
translation.Place a band around your upper arms, jus: Place a band around your upper arms, just above the elbows.
translation.Assume a push-up position with your hand: Assume a push-up position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line from head to heels.
translation.Bend your elbows and lower your chest to: Bend your elbows and lower your chest towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your sides
translation.Push through your palms to extend your a: Push through your palms to extend your arms and return to the starting position.
translation.Sit on a bench or chair with your legs s: Sit on a bench or chair with your legs spread apart and your feet flat on the ground.
translation.Hold one end of the band in your hand an: Hold one end of the band in your hand and step on the other end with your foot on the same side.
translation.Lean forward slightly and rest your elbo: Lean forward slightly and rest your elbow on the inside of your thigh, just above the knee.
translation.With your palm facing up, slowly curl yo: With your palm facing up, slowly curl your hand towards your shoulder, keeping your upper arm stationary.
translation.Pause for a moment at the top, then slow: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your hand back down to the starting position.
translation.Repeat for the desired number of repetit: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.
translation.band one arm overhead biceps curl: band one arm overhead biceps curl
translation.Stand with your feet shoulder-width apar: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place one end of the band under your foot.
translation.Hold the other end of the band with your: Hold the other end of the band with your arm fully extended overhead, palm facing forward.
translation.Keeping your upper arm stationary, curl: Keeping your upper arm stationary, curl your forearm towards your shoulder, squeezing your biceps.
translation.Pause for a moment at the top, then slow: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your forearm back to the starting position.
translation.Repeat for the desired number of repetit: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms.
translation.Stand with your feet shoulder-width apar: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band with both hands, palms facing down.
translation.Extend your arms straight out to the sid: Extend your arms straight out to the sides, keeping them parallel to the ground.
translation.Slowly bend your elbows and bring your h: Slowly bend your elbows and bring your hands towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms still.
translation.Pause for a moment, then slowly extend y: Pause for a moment, then slowly extend your arms back out to the starting position.
translation.Stand up straight with your feet shoulde: Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell in each hand, palms facing forward.
translation.Keep your upper arms stationary and exha: Keep your upper arms stationary and exhale as you curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
translation.Continue to raise the barbells until you: Continue to raise the barbells until your biceps are fully contracted and the barbells are at shoulder level.
translation.Hold the contracted position for a brief: Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
translation.Inhale as you slowly begin to lower the: Inhale as you slowly begin to lower the barbells back to the starting position.
translation.Repeat for the desired number of repetit: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, alternating arms.
translation.Stand up straight with your feet shoulde: Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
translation.Place your upper arms against the arm bl: Place your upper arms against the arm blaster, keeping your elbows close to your torso.
translation.Keeping your upper arms stationary, exha: Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
translation.Continue to raise the barbell until your: Continue to raise the barbell until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level.
translation.Inhale and slowly begin to lower the bar: Inhale and slowly begin to lower the barbell back to the starting position.
translation.Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat: Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back pressed against the bench.
translation.Grasp the barbell with a close grip, sli: Grasp the barbell with a close grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart.
translation.Unrack the barbell and lower it slowly t: Unrack the barbell and lower it slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
translation.Pause for a moment when the barbell touc: Pause for a moment when the barbell touches your chest.
translation.Push the barbell back up to the starting: Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
translation.Grasp the band handles with an overhand: Grasp the band handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
translation.Extend your arms fully, pushing the band: Extend your arms fully, pushing the bands away from your chest.
translation.Slowly lower the bands back down to your: Slowly lower the bands back down to your chest, keeping your elbows at a 90-degree angle.
translation.Grasp the handles with a wide grip and k: Grasp the handles with a wide grip and keep your elbows slightly bent.
translation.Push yourself back up to the starting po: Push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your arms.
translation.Attach the band to a sturdy anchor point: Attach the band to a sturdy anchor point at chest height.
translation.Stand with your side facing the anchor p: Stand with your side facing the anchor point and grab the band with one hand.
translation.Step away from the anchor point to creat: Step away from the anchor point to create tension in the band.
translation.Position your feet shoulder-width apart: Position your feet shoulder-width apart and slightly bend your knees.
translation.Bring your hand holding the band across: Bring your hand holding the band across your body, towards the opposite shoulder.
translation.While maintaining tension in the band, p: While maintaining tension in the band, push your hand forward and away from your body, extending your arm
translation.Slowly return to the starting position a: Slowly return to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
translation.Switch sides and repeat the exercise wit: Switch sides and repeat the exercise with the other hand.
translation.Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip: Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
translation.Lift the barbell off the rack and hold i: Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it directly above your chest with your arms fully extended.
translation.Lower the barbell slowly towards your ch: Lower the barbell slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in.
translation.Push the barbell back up to the starting: Push the barbell back up to the starting position by extending your arms.
translation.Lie down on a decline bench with your he: Lie down on a decline bench with your head lower than your hips and your feet secured.
translation.Hold the barbell with a pronated grip (p: Hold the barbell with a pronated grip (palms facing away from you) and your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
translation.Extend your arms above your chest, keepi: Extend your arms above your chest, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
translation.Lower the barbell in an arc motion behin: Lower the barbell in an arc motion behind your head, feeling a stretch in your chest and shoulders.
translation.Pause for a moment, then return the barb: Pause for a moment, then return the barbell to the starting position by reversing the motion.
translation.Sit on a bench or chair with your feet f: Sit on a bench or chair with your feet flat on the ground.
translation.Hold the band with an overhand grip, pal: Hold the band with an overhand grip, palms facing down, and wrap it around your fingers.
translation.Rest your forearms on your thighs, with: Rest your forearms on your thighs with your wrists hanging off the edge.
translation.Slowly curl your wrists upward, squeezin: Slowly curl your wrists upward, squeezing your forearms.
translation.Pause for a moment at the top, then slow: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position.
translation.Hold the band with both hands, palms fac: Hold the band with both hands, palms facing up, and rest your forearms on your thighs.
translation.barbell palms down wrist curl over a ben: barbell palms down wrist curl over a bench
translation.Sit on a bench with your feet flat on th: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your forearms resting on your thighs, palms facing down.
translation.Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, ha: Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
translation.Lower the barbell towards the ground by: Lower the barbell towards the ground by flexing your wrists, keeping your forearms stationary.
translation.Pause for a moment at the bottom, then s: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then slowly raise the barbell back up by extending your wrists.
translation.barbell palms up wrist curl over a bench: barbell palms up wrist curl over a bench
translation.Sit on a bench with your feet flat on th: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and hold a barbell with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
translation.Rest your forearms on the bench, allowin: Rest your forearms on the bench, allowing your wrists to hang off the edge.
translation.Keeping your forearms stationary, exhale: Keeping your forearms stationary exhale and curl your wrists upwards as far as possible.
translation.Hold the contracted position for a brief: Hold the contracted position for a brief pause, then inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
translation.Sit on a bench with your feet flat on th: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent.
translation.Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, pa: Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, palms facing down, and your hands shoulder-width apart.
translation.Rest your forearms on your thighs, allow: Rest your forearms on your thighs, allowing your wrists to hang off the edge.
translation.Keeping your forearms stationary, exhale: Keeping your forearms stationary exhale and curl your wrists upward as far as possible.
translation.Sit on a bench with your feet flat on th: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
translation.Slowly curl your wrists upward, bringing: Slowly curl your wrists upward, bringing the barbell towards your body.
translation.Pause for a moment at the top, then slow: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
translation.Stand up straight with your feet shoulde: Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip.
translation.Rest the barbell on the back of your han: Rest the barbell on the back of your hands with your palms facing down and your fingers pointing towards your body.
translation.Keeping your upper arms stationary, exha: Keeping your upper arms stationary exhale and curl your wrists upwards as far as possible.
translation.Sit on a bench with your feet flat on th: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your forearms resting on your thighs, holding a barbell with an underhand grip.
translation.Allow the barbell to roll down to your f: Allow the barbell to roll down to your fingertips, keeping your wrists straight.
translation.Slowly curl the barbell up towards your: Slowly curl the barbell up towards your forearms by flexing your wrists.
translation.Hold a barbell with an underhand grip, p: Hold a barbell with an underhand grip, palms facing up, and your hands shoulder-width apart.
translation.Slowly curl your wrists upward, bringing: Slowly curl your wrists upward, bringing the barbell towards your forearms.
translation.Attach a cable to a low pulley and sit o: Attach a cable to a low pulley and sit on a bench facing the cable machine.
translation.Grasp the cable handle with an overhand: Grasp the cable handle with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
translation.Pause for a moment at the top, then inha: Pause for a moment at the top, then inhale and slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position.
